Package assn3

Class RecipeManager

java.lang.Object
assn3.RecipeManager
public class RecipeManager extends Object
This class is used to manage a list of recipes. It provides functionality to update the ordered quantity for a specific recipe, get shopping list text of required ingredients based on user's orders, and load recipes from a file.
Since:
17.0.11
Version:
1.01
Author:
Ha Nhu Y Tran

  • Field Details

    • recipes

      private List<Recipe> recipes
      The list of recipes managed by RecipeManager. Each recipe includes information of its name, ingredients and ordered quantities

  • Constructor Details

    • RecipeManager

      public RecipeManager()
      Create no-arg constructor

  • Method Details

    • getRecipes

      public List<Recipe> getRecipes()
      Returns the list of recipes managed by this RecipeManager class.
      Returns:
      a list of recipes

    • order

      public void order(int breadIndex, int breadQuantity) throws IllegalStateException
      Updates the ordered quantity for a specific recipe.
      Parameters:
      breadIndex - the index of the recipe in the list
      breadQuantity - the quantity to add to the ordered quantity
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the total ordered quantity is negative

    • getShoppingListText

      public String getShoppingListText()
      Create a shopping list of required ingredients for the current orders.
      Returns:
      a string containing details of the shopping list

    • loadRecipes

      public void loadRecipes(String filePath)
      This is used to load recipes from a file and adds them to the recipes list. Each recipe includes a name and five ingredients: sugar, eggs, flour, yeast, and butter. If a recipe name is missing, an error message is displayed and the recipe is skipped.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file containing recipe data

    • printToFile

      public void printToFile(String fileName)
      Writes the shopping list text to a specified file. This method retrieves the shopping list text and writes it to the given file. If the file already exists, its content will be overwritten.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file including the file's path to write the shopping list text to.
